bn19GsBPCN8SectqRu3kag.text: The cutest place off the crowded streets of the area. The barista was kind and the coffee was delicious. I didn't have a change to try the pastries because I'm gluten free; however, they looked delicious!

0XozkPkYZXvxNXSgC2OaZQ.text: My husband and I had one mission for our stay in Edinburgh (well, other than enjoy the hell out of our last stop on our two-week vacation, that is...) - we were going to conquer the Disloyal 7 challenge. (Is it a challenge, or did we just make it into a challenge of our own?)  First stop on our first morning in Edinburgh: Baba Budan. My brother and his girlfriend met us at our hotel, and all four of us walked over to Baba Budan, the closest of the 7.   Side note: pay attention the doors you're entering. We accidentally tried to walk into their kitchen. Oopsie!  The cafe itself is super tiny, and they only had two girls working the drinks (the guys in the kitchen walk meals over, if you're interested). My husband, brother and I all ordered hot drinks, and it took every ounce of my willpower to not order a couple of donuts to snack on. The only thing that stopped me was the fact that we were heading over to hike up Arthur's Seat, and I didn't love the idea of making that trek with a dozen donuts in my back pocket. We *did* say that we'd come back for the donuts, but that never happened. I need a do-over!  The drinks were warm and tasty, but it took an awful long time for us to get them. The space is funky and inviting, with an arched ceiling and shared tables. The girls were nice, but a bit distracted.  Nevertheless, we got the Disloyal 7 cards at this stop, collected our first stamp and drinks, and went on our merry way.  1 out of 7 down!

photos.caption: Photo of Baba Budan - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Great space!
Photo of Baba Budan - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Counter

igQjSWBaV6-poBEELTTK2Q.text: I wouldn't go here if you are looking for a sit-down breakfast, but it's perfect for a quick one or maybe a donut and coffee. They have so many great and unique flavors. I got the salted caramel donut...delicious!!! The location is great but my only complaint is that there is very little seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Baba Budan - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Baba Budan - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

HKBNNV2NRXCIzb66ePadhg.text: You can't get more hipster than Baba Budan. From their decor to their menu, everything at Baba Budan is creative, exotic, fun and delicious. I was very hesitant at their breakfast donut but oh boy it was great! They have several fillings and I had the salted chocolate while my friend got the lemon zest. I loved mine. It was flavorful but not too sweet. I also saw their weekend brunch menu. It was soooooo interesting and smelled sooooo good. Too bad I missed it.  Good cute spot for a quick coffee, donut or brunch. Highly recommend!

5cji0G4LYRjJAZ38KUZw4A.text: Woo! This place is awesome. Homemade donuts and delicious coffee (and a very cute barista to boot). Some friends and I came here on a Tuesday afternoon and the place was packed, inside and out. Thankfully we found a spot to enjoy our puffy pastries. I had a blueberry jam-filled donut and a flat white; a perfect pair. Service was great. Vibes were chill. Donuts were slammin'.

3IvLVKgAMu2pMqLUHZGp2A.text: Baba Budan was the legendary coffee smuggler who introduced coffee to India from Yemen, and brought the delight of those little caffeinated beans to the world. The shop, named in his honour, is one of the new additions to East Market Street (which is becoming a really exciting scene).  Having spied their doughnuts on Instagram, I knew I had to pop by at the earliest opportunity. It's just a wee shop situated in one of the recently renovated arches underneath Jeffrey Street, so takeaway is the main order of the day. The staff were lovely, making conversation about how much they liked my specs (cheers guys), and just generally being friendly and helpful. I picked up two doughnuts - one cranachan and one lemon meringue, and a little espresso to go. I'm not particularly snobbish about coffee (I like good coffee but beyond that I don't really mind who the roaster or is or where it originates from), so was happy to take the barista's recommendation of a single origin (from somewhere, I didn't pay enough attention) for my espresso. Strong, but good.  I saved the doughnuts for later, in fact I've just had mine for breakfast. It's filled with delicious cream, and covered in sugar. Naughty, but nice - deep fried dough and interesting flavours. We're increasingly spoiled in Edinburgh for purveyors of artisan doughnuts, it's obviously our newest thing, but I, for one, am not complaining!

photos.caption: Photo of Baba Budan - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Baba Budan interior.
Photo of Baba Budan - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious doughnuts.

2Q-41onF63YuOnkVzdXF3Q.text: This cafe is the perfect place to stop while exploring Edinburgh. The location is right off the Royal Mile. Great outdoor seating and a small amount of indoor seating available as well. The donuts are nothing short of incredible, I tried both the salted caramel and blackberry filled donuts and my friend had the chocolate filled one... all were equally amazing. The latte and cappuccinos were great as well. Will definitely return here on my next trip to Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Baba Budan - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

tTGqjCww9HR7E595lABewA.text: Come for the doughnuts. Eat more doughnuts.  Light dough with airy filling makes these seem less sinful than I'm sure they are. I devoured mine because I was starving and thoroughly enjoyed every bite.  My latte was a bit of a let down - more like a flat white and somewhat bitter.  Despite the coffee, I'd hang here all day scoffing fabulous doughnuts.

sKBrNCXTHoiylBtA9ctCSA.text: We had breakfast here and it was fantastic. Super coffee. They were doing a special porridge selection - the apple and carmelised nuts version we had was lovely. The donuts were great. The regular breakfast menu wasn't on that morning but we walked by the next day and they looked very good.

4HhjkbFy9USNiEnPWizK_g.text: I'll keep this short. I had probably the tastiest doughnut I've ever tasted today. Popped into the small but cool Baba Budan at the Arches for a coffee and doughnut. Coffee was really good but the doughnut was awesome. I chose passion fruit cream filling. I thought it might be over kill and waste the flavour of doughnut itself but it was brilliant. Mopped up every last drop of the filling with my finger it was so good. A range of unusual flavours available too. Forget Krispy Kreme nonsense - this is the place to try real tasty doughnuts.
